name: CocoRosie
description:
'''CocoRosie''' is an American musical group formed in 2003 by sisters Sierra Rose "Rosie" and Bianca Leilani "Coco" Casady. The group's music has been described as [[folktronica]], [[freak folk]] and "[[New Weird America]]", and incorporates elements of [[pop music|pop]], [[blues]], [[opera]], [[electronica]], and [[hip hop music|hip hop]]. The group has released seven [[Album|studio albums]], ''[[La maison de mon rêve|La Maison de Mon Rêve]]'' (2004), [[Noah's Ark (album)|''Noah's Ark'']] (2005), ''[[The Adventures of Ghosthorse and Stillborn]]'' (2007), ''[[Grey Oceans]]'' (2010), ''[[Tales of a GrassWidow]]'' (2013), ''[[Heartache City]]'' (2015), and ''[[Put the Shine On]]'' (2020), and two [[Extended play|EPs]], ''[[Beautiful Boyz]]'' (2004) and ''[[Coconuts, Plenty of Junk Food]]'' (2009). They released their sixth album ''Heartache City'' on their own [[record label]], Lost Girl Records.

Originally a [[Duet|duo]], the group was formed when Bianca, who was living in [[New York City]] at the time, made an impromptu visit to Sierra at her [[Paris]] apartment, reconnecting with her for the first time in ten years. The sisters began creating music together, singing over instrumentals produced using a combination of [[Folk instrument|traditional instruments]] and [[Found object (music)|found objects]], most notably [[Toy|children's toys]]. They later expanded to a group and added various [[Session musician|backing musicians]], including a [[bassist]], [[keyboardist]], [[Beatboxing|beatboxer]], and [[Synthesizer|synth]] player.

CocoRosie has performed and toured in North America, South America, and at many prominent European venues and [[festival]]s such as the [[Olympia (Paris)|Olympia]], the [[Grand Rex]], the [[Concertgebouw, Amsterdam|Royal Concertgebouw]], [[Pukkelpop]], and [[Lowlands (festival)|Lowlands Festival]]. In 2009, music magazine Better Propaganda named CocoRosie the 16th most influential artist of the [[2000s in music|2000s]].
